alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 28 at 5:19PM CDT until April 28 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL HARLAN COUNTY... At 515 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Oxford, or 14 miles southwest of Holdrege, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Storm Chaser. At 429 PM CDT...Storm chasers measured 2 inch diameter hail 2 miles north of Oxford. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rural portions of northwestern Harlan County THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows.
